summary: This document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, outlining the distribution of his estate, the appointment of executors, and the management of his assets after his death. It specifies the responsibilities and powers of the executors and includes provisions regarding the handling of taxes and the trust established under the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust Agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the individual making the will, outlining his wishes for the distribution of his estate.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Darren K. Indyke is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will.

persons.name: Joseph Pagano
persons.context: Joseph Pagano is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will.

persons.name: James E. Staley
persons.context: James E. Staley is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will.

persons.name: David Mitchell
persons.context: David Mitchell is appointed as the successor executor in case any of the primary executors fail to qualify or cease to act.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein's will revokes all prior wills and codicils.
Epstein appoints Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and James E. Staley as executors of his estate.
David Mitchell is named as a successor executor.
The will includes provisions for the payment of debts, taxes, and executor compensation.
Epstein's estate is to be managed according to the provisions of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust.
